title: (SCTP) Cloud Computing and DevOps Programme | Singapore Institute of Technology

meta.description: A 4+ month programme that equips learners with cloud and DevOps skills to enhance agility, efficiency, and competitiveness in digital environments.

text_lines: Browse Professional Exams and Preparatory Courses
Browse Professional Exams and Preparatory Courses
A 4+ month programme that equips learners with cloud and DevOps skills to enhance agility, efficiency, and competitiveness in digital environments.
Cloud Computing, Project Management, Programming and Software Development, Career Growth and Transition
As organisations are moving their applications and data to cloud platforms with enhanced security, the demand for cloud computing and DevOps skills is one the rise.

Key factors include the cost savings and scalability of cloud solutions, which support remote work and innovation. In DevOps, faster delivery, improved teamwork, and automation enhance reliability and customer satisfaction.

This programme focuses on the essential skills required for modern-day cloud computing and DevOps professionals, equipping aspiring and current infocomm technology professionals to thrive in the fast-paced digital landscape.

Learners will gain a strong understanding of cloud computing concepts, platforms, and services while mastering DevOps methodologies for efficient software delivery. Topics include cloud infrastructure, platform and software services, security, and cost optimisation, along with DevOps principles and automation techniques to streamline development and deployment processes.
They will also apply their skills into practice with a Capstone Project, demonstrating the ability to design, implement, and manage cloud-based solutions.
Individuals with STEM-related work experience looking to pivot into a career in cloud computing for roles such as:
Individuals should possess a relevant background, which may include:
A minimum of a STEM-related diploma; or
Completion of a STEM-related BootCamp programme within the past three years; or
Relevant work experience in the Infocomm sector or related job roles; or
Prior or current work experience in a STEM-related field.
Explain the foundational concepts of IT cloud infrastructure, cloud technologies, and cloud computing
Demonstrate an understanding of deploying cloud solutions and outline key principles of cloud security and governance

Identify and explain the core components of cloud infrastructure—virtual machines, storage, networking, databases, and content delivery networks—while mastering major cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, and GCP
Design scalable and resilient cloud architectures to meet business needs, implementing application and infrastructure deployments using infrastructure as code and CI/CD techniques
Manage cloud resources efficiently while applying security best practices to identify vulnerabilities and tackle challenges in migration, governance, and compliance
Identify cloud security threats and vulnerabilities, exploring shared responsibility models while applying IAM and RBAC measures to enhance security
Secure data at rest and in transit with encryption, implement firewalls and VPNs for network security, and perform patch management and vulnerability scanning to maintain system integrity

Recognise and apply compliance standards (e.g., PCI DSS, HIPAA, GDPR, ISO 27001), conduct audits, and develop incident response strategies for cloud environments while exploring emerging cloud security technologies
Demonstrate the ability to implement DevSecOps and DevOps concepts for deploying secure and agile technological solutions
Module 5: Cloud Administration, Optimisation and Operations
Design, deploy, and manage cloud infrastructure, gaining proficiency in cloud networking, storage, and compute services while optimising resource utilisation and performance
Manage cloud spending and resource allocation while applying security best practices and compliance standards to ensure secure, cost-effective operations

Apply robust cloud computing practices on major platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) while developing problem-solving skills to optimise performance, troubleshoot applications, and implement backup and disaster recovery strategies
Module 6: Capstone Project on Cloud Computing and DevOps

Synthesise and apply the cloud computing and DevOps skills acquired throughout the previous five learning modules in the Capstone Project, effectively demonstrating their problem-solving and solutioning capabilities relating to cloud domains to potential employers

Wong Shen Nan has dedicated his career to software and cloud engineering for the past three years, holding the position of Senior DevSecOps Engineer. In this role, he oversees GitOps, Platform Engineering, and the implementation of secure CI/CD processes.

Previously, he co-founded and served as the CTO of ZOLO, a venture-backed startup offering an AI-driven platform designed for food suppliers. He also played a key role in the founding engineering team of RecycleGoWhere, a project under Better.sg that received funding from SGEcoFund and was recognised in Parliament for its potential contribution to environmental sustainability. Additionally, Shen Nan provides consultancy to various startups in areas such as team management, market entry strategies, technology risk, and cloud cost management through his consultancy, Fracxional.

He graduated from NUS with an Honours degree in Bachelor of Science and acquired many professional qualifications including an AWS Solutions Architect Associate certification (2023), and a Specialist Diploma in Applied AI from NYP (2024).

Ilia Tivin is currently the Managing Director of Locked Jar, an information and cybersecurity consulting firm. He is also the Head of DIY Infrastructure at SELFHOSTED which revolutionises the way digital enthusiasts and businesses approach their online presence and host their data. He is also a seasonal lecturer at James Cook University and a trainer for many corporations.

With over 19 years of professional tech and digital data security experience, his corporate career spanned working with Hewlett Packard as a Senior Security Consultant to Asia Pacific Security Professional Leader managing tech infrastructure, digital data security, data centre, and cloud security businesses. He also worked with CISCO as an ASEAN Customer Success Specialist to engage customers in adopting CISCO’s solutions to transform their business outcomes. He is well equipped with corporate experience in cloud technology, cybersecurity, data security, business data analytics, business development, and customer success engagement.

His education qualifications include a bachelor's degree in management of information systems covering domain expertise in Business Data Analytics, Digital Business Infrastructure and Applications, and a Master of Science degree in Management. Both his bachelor’s and master’s degrees are from University College Dublin.
Classes are held once a week from 9:00 am – 12:00 pm over four+ months
Classes are held online twice a week from 7:00 pm – 10:00 pm over four+ months
Asynchronous e-Learning with research and reading materials
Capstone project, self-learning with project consultation and final project presentation
A Certificate of Participation will be issued to participants who:
Attend at least 75% of the course
Undertake and pass non-credit bearing assessment during the course
The full fee for this course is S$16,350.00.
Singapore Citizen who meets the additional course fee funding support criteria
All fees above include GST. GST applies to individuals and Singapore-registered companies.
Additional Course Fee Funding Support Criteria
To be eligible for 95% additional course fee funding support, applicants must be a Singapore Citizen and meet one of the following criteria:
Long-term unemployed individual (unemployed for six months or more); or

Individual in need of financial assistance – ComCare Short-to-Medium Term Assistance (SMTA) recipient or Workfare Income Supplement (WIS) recipient. Additionally, they should not have received any other funding from government sources in respect of the actual grant disbursed for the programme.
Learn more about funding schemes available
If you have further questions regarding the SkillsFuture Career Transition Programme, do get in touch with our career coach Joe Leong via

From Wilderness to Workplace: Finding Purpose and Power Through Lifelong Learning

“These programmes…are more than technical certifications – they're fundamental operating systems for professional effectiveness.” 
-- Eltian Chen, Graduate of (SCTP) Programme for the Lean Six Sigma Champion and Operational Excellence Manager
Lean and Six Sigma, Career Growth and Transition
More alumni return to S’pore universities to study, but more support needed
More people are returning to their alma mater for further studies over the past few years, with government support and more alumni engagement.
Career Growth and Transition, Competency-based Education
Upskilling is Not an Uphill Task

Questions like “Am I too old?”, “Will I be able to keep up?” and “Can I afford it?” are often on the minds of adult learners when considering upskilling and upgrading. Robin Ngan, Director of the SITLEARN, tackles these questions and shares tips for how to make the most of one’s lifelong learning journey.
Competency-based Education, Career Growth and Transition

Is learning new skills still relevant after 40? This was the question Resendos faced while contemplating taking up a postgraduate certificate course at SIT. His decision to constantly upskill himself shaped his entrepreneurial journey.
Business Management, Design Innovation, Career Growth and Transition
Lifelong Learning - Upskill with SITizens Learning Credits

To grow professionally, lifelong learning is practically a must when adapting in today’s VUCA world. As a graduate from Singapore Institute of Technology (SIT), how can you make use of the resources on hand to progress in your career?
Business Management, Career Growth and Transition
Agile Orientation for Digital Transformation: Concepts, Practices and Mindsets
Master Agile methodology in this 2-day course. Gain theory, practical skills, and toolkits for real-world implementation and success

Specialised micro-credential for strong technical and theoretical foundation in digital and IT fundamentals, programming, logic and discrete structures. Earn a Specialist Certificate and stack it towards a degree in Applied Computing.
Bachelor of Science (Honours) in Applied Computing (via the CSM Pathway)
Programming and Software Development, Computer Architecture, Competency-based Education
A 3+ month programme covering digital product management, agile methods, UX design, and metrics, preparing you for CSPO certification.
Up to 95% Course Fees Funding & Up to $3,000 Monthly Training Allowance
Business Management, Project Management, Career Growth and Transition

This module provides a fundamental understanding of the principles of project management, as defined by the Project Management Institute's (PMI's) latest version of the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK).
Postgraduate Certificate in Building Services Engineering
This specialised micro-credential imparts cloud computing skills, covering architecture, big data analytics, and security.
Bachelor of Science (Honours) in Applied Computing (via the CSM Pathway)
Cloud Computing, Cybersecurity, Computer Architecture, Competency-based Education
(SCTP) Data Analytics and Business Intelligence Programme
A 4+ month programme covering data analytics, with hands-on experience using tools like SQL, Python, and Tableau for practical industry applications.
Up to 95% Course Fees Funding & Up to $3,000 Monthly Training Allowance
Data Science and Analytics, Business Management, Career Growth and Transition
